intro: Solanum butaguense, commonly known as the Butaguense nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with five petals, and it produces small, round berries that are toxic to humans. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
